channel.title: How to make this in a continous loop
channel.description:
I've got this:
[code] stillgfx(277, absY, absX);[/code]
And I want it to continue looping until I add a command for it to stop. How can I make it to carry on, and then stop with a command?

item.title: How to make this in a continous loop
item.dc:creator: @zubmage zubmage
item.description:
@zubmage wrote:

I see. Thank you very much Graham and Lusfr

Read full topic
item.source: How to make this in a continous loop

item.title: How to make this in a continous loop
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

When you want to turn it on, set it to true. When you want to turn it off, set it to false.

Read full topic

item.source: How to make this in a continous loop

item.title: How to make this in a continous loop
item.dc:creator: @LOL_AT_THIS_FORUM LOL AT THIS FORUM
item.description:
@LOL_AT_THIS_FORUM wrote:

[quote=“Graham, post:5, topic:191319”]You’ll need to declare a variable like this:

private boolean loopstillgfx = false;

Then add this to your process:

if(loopstillgfx)
{
stillgfx(277, absY, absX);
}

Then just do loopstillgfx = true; to start, and = false; to stop.[/quote]mine r beta!!!

Read full topic
item.source: How to make this in a continous loop

item.title: How to make this in a continous loop
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

You’ll need to declare a variable like this:

private boolean loopstillgfx = false;

Then add this to your process:

if(loopstillgfx)
{
stillgfx(277, absY, absX);
}

Then just do loopstillgfx = true; to start, and = false; to stop.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make this in a continous loop
